pageContent: LOGINLOGOUTHELPPrinter FriendlyPageEarthfiles, news category.Share:DiggFacebookStumbleUponPart 1: Windmill Hill Pattern Near Ancient Avebury Came in Rain© 2008 by Linda Moulton Howe Rain was heavy in Wiltshire County, England, even flooding roads, the first week of August 2009.But at Windmill Hill near Avebury Trusloe, a 350-foot-diameter pattern of circles on ringswith complex dumbbells in the center was reported on August 6. Aerial image © 2009 by FrankLaumen, Visible Signs.de . More information and images: Cropcircleconnector.com. August 12, 2009 Albuquerque, New Mexico - I returned from England today with myphotographs of the 350-foot-diameter formation at Windmill Hill near Avebury Trusloe inWiltshire County. There was heavy rain in Wiltshire through nearly every day and night oflate July and the first week of August. British newspapers reported that the unrelentingrain was delaying crop harvests in Wiltshire, Devon and other regions of England.All day and night of August 5 to 6, there had been rain in Wiltshire, so I was surprisedwhen Charles Mallett, Director of the Silent Circle Research Centre in Compton Bassett,told me there was a report of a new formation at Windmill Hill. I took the following imagesthat August 6 morning when it rained so much I struggled to keep the camera from gettingtoo wet between shots, worried that it might stop working in all the moisture.The next day on August 7, 2009, Charles Mallett took his 20-foot-pole and camera to theWindmill Hill formation when the sun finally came out for awhile. Those photos are in Part2 of this Earthfiles report. Rainy Morning of August 6, 2009Windmill Hill near Avebury Trusloe, Wiltshire County, EnglandImages © 2009 by Linda Moulton Howe.Wavy, Watery Lay of Wheat in Large Crescent Bands

“Chaos” of This Circle Actually Cross-Hatched “Order”Steam rising from warm ground in above and below images.

One Circle Seems Unconnected to Orbital Lines, But Where Is It in Aerials?Where is the connecting thin, orbital line to this circle at least twelve feetfrom where I stood on an orbital line to take this photograph the morning of August 6, 2009,soon after the large Windmill Hill formation was first reported?
